text.0: a home is made for thee to dwell in indra o muchinvoked go thitherwith the heroes.
text.1: that thou to prosper us mayst be our helper vouchsafe us wealth rejoice with draughts of soma.
text.2: indra thy wish twicestrong is comprehended pressed is the soma poured are pleasant juices.
text.3: this hymn of praise from loosened tongue made perfect draws indra to itself with loud invoking.
text.4: come thou impetuous god from earth or heaven come to our holy grass to drink the soma.
text.5: hither to me let thy bay horses bring thee to listen to our hymns and make thee joyful.
text.6: come unto us with all thine aids accordant lord of bay steeds accepting our devotions.
text.7: fairhelmeted oercoming with the mighty and lending us the strength of bulls o indra.
text.8: as to the chariot pole a vigorous courser this laud is brought to the great strong upholder.
text.9: this hymn solicits wealth of thee in heaven as twere above the sky set thou our glory.
text.10: with precious things o indra thus content us may we attain to thine exalted favour.
text.11: send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
